articles.title: AAPL Q1 Earnings Call: Growth Across Core Products, AI Integration, and Tariff Risks
articles.content: iPhone and iPad maker Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) reported Q1 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 5.1% year on year to $95.36 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.65 per share was 1.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

articles.title: Private equity titan Robert Smith: Tech stocks are still the place to be
articles.content: Vista Equity Partners chairman, founder, and CEO Robert Smith makes the case to own tech stocks despite a more volatile economic backdrop.

articles.title: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Berkshire, Microsoft, Apple, Netflix, Palantir, On Semi, Tyson, Skechers, and More
articles.content: Berkshire Hathaway’s Class B shares fall after Warren Buffett says he’ll be stepping down as CEO at the end of the year, and Netflix declines as President Donald Trump says he authorized a 100% tariff on films produced overseas. Palantir Technologies, meanwhile, is scheduled to report quarterly earnings later Monday.

articles.title: Buy, Sell, or Hold These Mag 7 Stocks After Earnings: AAPL, AMZN
articles.content: Markets haven't kept the momentum investors were hoping for after receiving much-anticipated quarterly results from Amazon (AMZN) and Apple (AAPL) last Thursday.
